The claim states that Kentucky Rep: Andy Barr would let shady payday lenders take advantage of troops and that he took $36,550 from payday lenders.
The claim is backed by the: cross-partisan" group With Honor, which supports military veterans running for Congress and has endorsed Barr's Democratic challenger, Amy McGrath.
The claim is based on Barr: s support of the payday lending business and his acceptance of campaign donations from payday lending organizations.
The claim highlights Barr: s vote for the Financial CHOICE Act in 2017, which aimed to weaken the power of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and remove its oversight of payday lenders.
